intro: Argyrolobium divaricatum, commonly known as the variable silver-lobed pea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and has the ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia bacteria. Due to its unique appearance and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
